Extensions are additions to an existing metadata standard that enables additional functionality or meet other functional requirements.

Extension Template

---
title: {Full name of the extension}
name: {Short filename to identify the extension data}
website: {URL to a website supporting the extension}
description: |
  {Multiline description of the extension which can span a section that needs to
  be indented if there is a need for an extended description}
subjects:
  # From enumerated application specific subject list}
  - {Subject 1}
  - {Subject 2}
disciplines:
  # From HESA JACS Codes: http://www.hesa.ac.uk/content/view/1776/649/}
  - {Discipline 1}
  - {Discipline 2}
standards:
  # name of related standard }
  - {Standard 1}
  - {Standard 2}
# The following are constants: do not modify
type: extension
layout: extension
---

Instructions

  1. Copy template:
  2. Goto GitHub: Add a new file
    1. This will fork a copy of the site's repository and allow you to edit a page.
  3. Paste in your boilerplate and edit away!
  4. Commit and then submit a pull request

Metadata Directory is maintained by Sean Chen and Kate Anne Alderete.
